sections.title: General
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Are the financial statements identified clearly and distinguished from other information in the same published document?
Does the entity present a statement (or statements) of financial performance for the reporting period?
Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the reporting period?
Does the entity present a statement of changes in equity for the reporting period?
Does the entity present a statement of cash flows for the reporting period?
Does the entity present notes for the reporting period?
Does the entity provide comparative information in respect of the preceding period as specified in IFRS 18.31–32?
Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period if required by IFRS 18.37?
Does the entity clearly identify each primary financial statement and the notes?
Does the entity disclose prominently the name of the reporting entity or other means of identification, and any change in that information from the end of the preceding reporting period?
Does the entity disclose prominently whether the financial statements are of an individual entity or a group of entities?
Does the entity disclose prominently the date of the end of the reporting period or the period covered by the financial statements?
Does the entity disclose prominently the presentation currency, as defined in IAS 21 The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates?
Does the entity disclose prominently the level of rounding used for the amounts in the financial statements?

If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes the domicile and legal form of the entity, its country of incorporation and the address of its registered office (or principal place of business)?
If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes a description of the nature of the entity's operations and its principal activities?
If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes the name of the parent and the ultimate parent of the group?
If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes information regarding the length of life if it is a limited-life entity?

Does the entity provide additional disclosures when compliance with IFRS is insufficient to enable users to understand the impact of transactions, events, and conditions on its financial position and performance?
Does the entity disclose an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRS Accounting Standards?
Does the entity disclose that management concluded the financial statements present fairly the entity's financial position, performance and cash flows?
Does the entity disclose that it has complied with applicable IFRSs, except where it departed to achieve a fair presentation?
Does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which it has departed?
Does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?
Does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?
Does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be misleading?
Does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?
Does the entity disclose, for each period presented, the financial effect of the departure on each item in the financial statements?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which it departed?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment the IFRS would require?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be misleading?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the financial effect on each item for each period presented?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS in question?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the nature of the requirement?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the reason why complying is misleading?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose, for each period, the adjustments that would be necessary for a fair presentation?
Does the entity disclose material uncertainties that may cast significant doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose that fact?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the basis on which they are prepared?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?
If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose the reporting period covered by the financial statements?
If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose the reason for using a longer or shorter period?
If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose that amounts are not entirely comparable?
Does the entity provide comparative information for the preceding period for all amounts reported in the current statements, except when IFRS permits or requires otherwise?
Does the entity include comparative narrative and descriptive information if necessary to understand the current period's financial statements?
If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the nature of the reclassification (including at the beginning of the preceding period)?
If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the amount of each item or class of items that is reclassified?
If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the reason for the reclassification?
If reclassification of comparatives is impracticable, does the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying the amounts?
If reclassification comparatives is impracticable, does the entity disclose the nature of the adjustments that would have been made?
Does the entity present the current and preceding period in each primary financial statement and in the notes?
When voluntarily presenting additional comparatives, does the entity present related note information for those additional statements?
In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?
In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period?
In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period?
When presenting a third statement of financial position, does the entity disclose the information required by IFRS 18.33–36 and IAS 8?
When presenting a third statement of financial position, is its date the beginning of the preceding period regardless of earlier comparative information?
Does the entity retain the presentation of items from one period to the next?
Does the entity retain the disclosure of items from one period to the next?
Does the entity retain the classification of items from one period to the next?
Does the entity disclose the date when the financial statements were authorised for issue?
Does the entity disclose who authorised the financial statements?
Does the entity disclose that owners or others have the power to amend the financial statements after issue, if applicable?

sections.title: Financial review by management
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Does the entity provide information for financial review by management, which is separate from the financial statements, that describes and explains the main features of its financial performance and financial position and the principal uncertainties it faces

sections.title: Aggregation and disaggregation
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Does the entity classify and aggregate assets, liabilities, equity, income, expenses or cash flows into items based on shared characteristics, unless doing so would override specific aggregation or disaggregation requirements in IFRS?
Does the entity disaggregate items based on characteristics that are not shared, unless doing so would override specific aggregation or disaggregation requirements in IFRS?

Does the entity aggregate or disaggregate items to present line items in the primary financial statements that fulfil their role of providing useful structured summaries, unless doing so would override specific IFRS requirements?

Does the entity aggregate or disaggregate items to disclose information in the notes that fulfils their role of providing material information, unless doing so would override specific IFRS requirements?
Does the entity ensure that its aggregation and disaggregation do not obscure material information, unless doing so would override specific IFRS requirements?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
Does the entity label and describe items presented in the primary financial statements or in the notes in a way that faithfully represents the characteristics of each item?
To faithfully represent an item, does the entity provide all descriptions and explanations necessary for users to understand that item?
Does the entity separately report assets and liabilities, and income and expenses, unless offsetting is required or permitted by an IFRS accounting standard?

sections.title: Statement of profit or loss
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
Does the entity include all items of income and expense in a reporting period in the statement of profit or loss, unless an IFRS accounting standard requires or permits otherwise?
If the entity invests in assets as a main business activity, does the entity disclose that fact?
If the entity provides financing to customers as a main business activity, does the entity disclose that fact?
If the outcome of the assessment has changed, does the entity disclose that fact and the date of the change?
Does the entity disclose the amount and classification of items of income and expense before and after the date of the change in the outcome of the assessment in the current period?
Does the entity disclose the amount and classification in the prior period for items whose classification changed because of the changed outcome of the assessment?
If the entity does not disclose the information specified in (c) above because it is impracticable, does it disclose that fact?

Does the entity classify and present income and expenses applying the change in outcome of the assessment prospectively from the date of the change and not reclassify amounts presented before that date?

Does the entity classify in the operating category all income and expenses included in the statement of profit or loss that are not classified in the investing, financing, income taxes, or discontinued operations categories?
Does the entity classify income and expenses related to investments in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries in the investing category?
Does the entity classify income and expenses related to cash and cash equivalents in the investing category?
Does the entity classify income and expenses related to other assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of its other resources in the investing category?

If the entity invests in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries and accounts for them using the equity method, does it classify related income and expenses in the investing category?

If the entity invests in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries and does not account for them using the equity method, does it classify related income and expenses in the operating category?

If the entity invests in financial assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of its other resources, does it classify related income and expenses on cash and cash equivalents in the operating category?

If the entity provides financing to customers and does not meet the criteria in IFRS 18.56(a), does it classify related income and expenses from cash and cash equivalents that relate to providing financing to customers in the operating category?

If the entity provides financing to customers and does not meet the criteria in IFRS 18.56(a), does it classify related income and expenses from cash and cash equivalents that do not relate to providing financing to customers based on an accounting policy choice between operating or investing category?

If the entity invests in other assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of its other resources, does it classify related income and expenses on those assets in the operating category?

Does the entity classify income and expenses from the initial and subsequent measurement of liabilities arising from transactions that involve only the raising of finance in the financing category, except as set out in IFRS 18.63–66?

Does the entity classify incremental expenses directly attributable to the issue and extinguishment of liabilities arising from transactions that involve only the raising of finance in the financing category?

Does the entity classify interest income and expenses from liabilities arising from transactions that do not involve only the raising of finance in the financing category if identified for IFRS purposes?

Does the entity classify income and expenses arising from changes in interest rates on liabilities arising from transactions that do not involve only the raising of finance in the financing category if identified for IFRS purposes?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a hedging instrument designated under IFRS 9 in the same category as the income and expenses affected by the risks managed?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a hedging instrument designated under IFRS 9 in the operating category if required to avoid grossing up?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on an undesignated component of a designated hedging instrument in the same category as the designated component?
Does the entity classify ineffective portions of a gain or loss in the same category as the effective portions?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not designated as a hedge under IFRS 9 in the same category as the income and expenses affected by the risks managed?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not designated as a hedge under IFRS 9 in the operating category if required to avoid grossing up or undue cost or effort?

Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not used to manage identified risks in the financing category if it relates to raising finance, or in the operating category if the entity provides financing to customers as a main business activity?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not used to manage identified risks in the operating category if the conditions in IFRS 18.B73(a) are not met?
Does the entity exclude from the financing category and classify in the operating category income and expenses from issued investment contracts with participation features recognised under IFRS 9?
Does the entity exclude from the financing category and classify in the operating category insurance finance income and expenses recognised under IFRS 17?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions involving only the raising of finance in the operating category when those liabilities relate to providing financing?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions involving only the raising of finance based on an accounting policy choice when those liabilities do not relate to providing financing?
If the entity cannot distinguish between liabilities related and not related to providing financing to customers, does it classify all related income and expenses in the operating category?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions not involving only the raising of finance in the financing category when specified in IFRS 18.61?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions not involving only the raising of finance in the operating category when not specified in IFRS 18.61?
Does the entity classify in the income taxes category tax expense or tax income included in the statement of profit or loss under IAS 12, including related foreign exchange differences?
Does the entity classify income and expenses from discontinued operations in the discontinued operations category as required by IFRS 5?
Does the entity classify foreign exchange differences recognized under IAS 21 in the same category as the items that gave rise to them, unless doing so would involve undue cost or effort?
If applying classification requirements in IFRS 18.B65 and B67 would involve undue cost or effort, does the entity classify the affected foreign exchange differences in the operating category?
Does the entity present totals and subtotals for operating profit or loss in the statement of profit or loss?
Does the entity present totals and subtotals for profit or loss before financing and income taxes, subject to IFRS 18.73?
Does the entity present totals and subtotals for profit or loss in the statement of profit or loss?
Are additional line items and subtotals comprised of amounts recognized and measured in accordance with IFRS?
Are additional line items and subtotals compatible with the structure required by IFRS 18.22?
Are additional line items and subtotals consistent from period to period, in accordance with IFRS 18.30?
Are additional line items and subtotals displayed no more prominently than the totals and subtotals required by IFRS?

sections.title: Statement presenting comprehensive income
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income a total for profit or loss?
Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income a total for other comprehensive income (see IFRS 18.B86–B87)?
Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income a total for comprehensive income, being the total of profit or loss and other comprehensive income?
Does the entity present an allocation of comprehensive income for the reporting period attributable to non-controlling interests?
Does the entity present an allocation of comprehensive income for the reporting period attributable to owners of the parent?
Does the entity classify income and expenses included in the statement presenting comprehensive income as those that will be reclassified to profit or loss when specific conditions are met?
Does the entity classify income and expenses included in the statement presenting comprehensive income as those that will not be reclassified to profit or loss?

Does the entity present, in each category of the statement presenting comprehensive income, a line item for the share of other comprehensive income of associates and joint ventures accounted for using the equity method?
Does the entity present, in each category of the statement presenting comprehensive income, a line item for other items of other comprehensive income?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?

Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income or disclose in the notes reclassification adjustments relating to components of other comprehensive income (see IFRS 18.B88–B89)?

If the entity discloses reclassification adjustments in the notes, does it present in the statement presenting comprehensive income the items of other comprehensive income after any related reclassification adjustments?

Does the entity either present in the statement presenting comprehensive income or disclose in the notes the amount of income taxes relating to each item of other comprehensive income, including reclassification adjustments?

sections.title: Statement of financial position
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: If the entity does not present separately current and non-current assets in its statement of financial position, does it present all assets in order of liquidity?
If the entity does not present separately current and non-current liabilities in its statement of financial position, does it present all liabilities in order of liquidity?

Does the entity disclose the amount expected to be recovered or settled after more than 12 months for each asset and liability line item that combines amounts expected to be recovered or settled within 12 months and amounts expected to be recovered or settled after 12 months?
If the entity distinguishes between current and non-current assets in its financial statements, does it present deferred tax assets as non-current assets?
If the entity distinguishes between current and non-current liabilities in its financial statements, does it present deferred tax liabilities as non-current liabilities?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is expected to be realised in, or is intended for sale or consumption in, the entity's normal operating cycle?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is held primarily for trading?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is expected to be realised within 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is cash or a cash equivalent, unless restricted from use to settle a liability for at least 12 months?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it expects to settle it in its normal operating cycle?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it holds it primarily for trading?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it is due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it does not have the right to defer settlement of the liability for at least 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify its financial liabilities as current if they are due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period, even if the original term was longer?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify its financial liabilities as current if an agreement to refinance or reschedule payments on a long-term basis is completed after the reporting period but before authorization of the financial statements?

If the entity breaches a covenant on a long-term loan arrangement on or before the end of the reporting period, causing the liability to become payable on demand, does it classify that liability as current even if the lender agreed after period-end not to demand payment?
If the entity classifies loan liabilities as non-current subject to covenant compliance within 12 months, does it disclose information about the covenants (nature and timing) in the notes?
If the entity classifies loan liabilities as non-current subject to covenant compliance within 12 months, does it disclose the carrying amount of those liabilities in the notes?

If the entity classifies loan liabilities as non-current subject to covenant compliance within 12 months, does it disclose facts and circumstances indicating possible difficulty in complying with the covenants?
Does the entity present property, plant and equipment as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present investment property as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present intangible assets as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present goodwill as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present financial assets (excluding amounts under g, j, k) as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present IFRS 17 contract assets, disaggregated per IFRS 17.78, as a separate line item?
Does the entity present investments accounted for using the equity method as a separate line item?
Does the entity present biological assets within the scope of IAS 41 as a separate line item?
Does the entity present inventories as a separate line item?
Does the entity present trade and other receivables as a separate line item?
Does the entity present cash and cash equivalents as a separate line item?
Does the entity present assets classified as held for sale and assets in disposal groups under IFRS 5 as a separate line item?
Does the entity present trade and other payables as a separate line item?
Does the entity present provisions as a separate line item?
Does the entity present financial liabilities (excluding trade payables and provisions) as a separate line item?
Does the entity present IFRS 17 contract liabilities, disaggregated per IFRS 17.78, as a separate line item?
Does the entity present current tax liabilities and assets as a separate line item?
Does the entity present deferred tax liabilities and assets as a separate line item?
Does the entity present liabilities in disposal groups under IFRS 5 as a separate line item?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
Does the entity present non-controlling interests in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present issued capital and reserves attributable to owners of the parent in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity include non-current assets held for sale and assets in disposal groups under IFRS 5 as a separate line item?
Does the entity include liabilities in disposal groups under IFRS 5 as a separate line item?

sections.title: Statement of changes in equity
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Does the statement of changes in equity include total comprehensive income for the reporting period, showing separately the total amounts attributable to owners of the parent and to non-controlling interests?
Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, the effects of retrospective application or retrospective restatement recognized in accordance with IAS 8?

Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing changes resulting from profit or loss?

Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing changes resulting from other comprehensive income?

Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing changes resulting from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners, showing separately contributions by and distributions to owners and changes in ownership interests in subsidiaries that do not result in a loss of control?
For each component of equity, does the entity either present in the statement of changes in equity or disclose in the notes an analysis of other comprehensive income by item?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
Does the entity present, either in the statement of changes in equity or in the notes, the amount of dividends recognised as distributions to owners during the reporting period?
Does the entity present, either in the statement of changes in equity or in the notes, the related amount of dividends per share?
Does the entity disclose the amount of transaction costs accounted for as a deduction from equity in the reporting period, in the statement of changes in equity or in the notes?

sections.title: Notes to the financial statements
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Do the notes disclose the basis of preparation of the financial statements?
Do the notes disclose the specific accounting policies used?
Do the notes disclose information required by IFRS accounting standards that is not presented in the primary financial statements?
Do the notes disclose information not presented in the primary financial statements but necessary for an understanding of any of them?
Does the entity present notes to the financial statements in a systematic manner, as far as practicable?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of financial performance to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of financial position to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of changes in equity to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of cash flows to any related information in the notes?

If amounts disclosed in the notes are included in one or more line items in the primary financial statements, does the entity disclose in the note the line item(s) in which those amounts are included?
Does the entity disclose information that enables users to evaluate the entity's objectives, policies and processes for managing capital?
Does the entity disclose qualitative information about its objectives, policies and processes for managing capital, including a description of what it manages as capital?
Does the entity disclose the nature of externally imposed capital requirements and how those requirements are incorporated into its management of capital?
Does the entity disclose how it is meeting its objectives for managing capital?
Does the entity disclose summary quantitative data about what it manages as capital?
Does the entity disclose any changes in its objectives, policies, processes or summary quantitative data from the preceding reporting period?
Does the entity disclose whether, during the reporting period, it complied with any externally imposed capital requirements to which it is subject?
If the entity did not comply with externally imposed capital requirements, does it disclose the consequences of such non-compliance?

sections.title: Management-defined performance measures
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: Does the entity disclose the aspect of financial performance that, in management's view, is communicated by a management-defined performance measure?
Does the entity disclose how the management-defined performance measure compares with the measures defined by IFRS accounting standards?

Does the entity disclose all management-defined performance measures in a single note, including a statement that they provide management's view of financial performance and are not necessarily comparable with similarly labeled measures of other entities?
Does the entity label and describe each management-defined performance measure in a way that faithfully represents its characteristics in accordance with IFRS 18.43?

If a measure is calculated other than by using the accounting policies used for items in the statement(s) of financial performance, does the entity disclose that fact and the calculations used for the measure?

If the calculation of a management-defined performance measure differs from policies required or permitted by IFRS, does the entity disclose that fact and, if necessary, explain the meaning of terms it uses?

Does the entity label the measure in a way that represents the characteristics of the subtotal (e.g., using the label 'operating profit before non-recurring expenses' only for a subtotal excluding identified non-recurring expenses)?

Does the entity explain the meaning of terms it uses in its descriptions that are necessary to understand the aspect of financial performance being communicated (e.g., how it defines 'non-recurring expenses')?

Does the entity disclose a description of the aspect of financial performance that, in management's view, is communicated by each management-defined performance measure, including why it provides useful information?
Does the entity disclose how each management-defined performance measure is calculated?
Does the entity disclose a reconciliation between each management-defined performance measure and the most directly comparable IFRS subtotal or total?
Does the entity disclose the income tax effect (applying IFRS 18.B141) and the effect on non-controlling interests for each item in the reconciliation?
Does the entity describe how it applies IFRS 18.B141 to determine the income tax effect required in the reconciliation?
If the entity changes, adds, or ceases a management-defined performance measure, does it disclose an explanation enabling users to understand the change and its effects?
Does the entity disclose the reasons for the change, addition, or cessation of a management-defined performance measure?
Does the entity provide restated comparative information to reflect the change, addition, or cessation, unless it is impracticable to do so?
If the entity does not disclose the required restated comparative information because it is impracticable, does it disclose that fact?

sections.title: Transition to IFRS 18
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 18.

items.question: If an entity applies IFRS 18, issued April 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2027, does it disclose that fact?

For the comparative period immediately preceding the first application of IFRS 18, does the entity disclose a reconciliation for each line item in the statement of profit or loss showing the amounts restated applying IFRS 18?

For the comparative period immediately preceding the first application of IFRS 18, does the entity disclose a reconciliation for each line item in the statement of profit or loss showing the amounts previously presented applying IAS 1?
